_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto. Shutoff at 85% min. Class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) point w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure, & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installation of N2 Generator system and process analyzer
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Sample Pump, Bartec Unit, vessel/pipe integrity, ESDs
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane [(1 x 90,000 gallons) plus lines, liquefied and stored under pressure], blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the "cold" season.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Doraville Terminal was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes. It is the intent of the Doraville Terminal to incorporate the most recent procedural guidance (NFPA #58-2011, API 510, API 570) to the extent feasible. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the DeKalb County Fire Rescue Department as well as the DeKalb County EMA. Medical emergencies will require notification of the local emergency medical services ("Emergency Medical Services") and Northside Hospital. This facility trains its employees to respond to small or initial stages of an emergency.



The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Doraville Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility comprised of  adjoined South, East and West Terminals that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one butane storage vessel located at the East Terminal.



The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of the system's butane storage vessel when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% fill shut-off with alarm at 80%) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The facility's alternate (with potential off-site impact) release scenario is a "BLEVE" accident and associated fireball.



The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Doraville Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) inclusive of the 14 required elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the ma

nufacturer's (Sunoco Partners Butane Blending, LLC), instructions and recommendations.



To date, this facility has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Motiva Enterprises LLC - Doraville Terminal's butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the DeKalb County Fire Rescue Department (Primary Response: Station #18) and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the fire department and the DeKalb County Emergency Management Agency. The DeKalb County Fire Rescue Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Motiva Enterprises, LLC looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, the DeKalb County Fire Rescue Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion, if feasible.  As this is a "new" system, there have been no accidents or incidents resulting in a significant release and subsequent death, injury, evacuation or sheltering-in-place.
